Thanks, but let=92s not get started on kodogu =96 it=92s a nightmare. I am
=
presently translating a piece by Fukushi sensei on the Higo Hirata School.
=
There is only one known signed piece and probably three generations of
Hira=
ta Hikozo. However, in the article Fukushi sensei admits that he cannot
tel=
l the difference from one generation to the next and so lumps everything
to=
gether as first generation. And, this is the easy stuff.

 

Gordon

Gordon -- well put. I tend to believe tha=
t a big part of the problem 
is that so few of us have venues to learn in p=
erson that the reliance 
on books overshadows the fact that you cannot lear=
n to recognize the 
nuances of hataraki from pictures. The details are lear=
ned by hands on 
study (OK -- that's loosely put LOL) and need guidance fro=
m those with 
great experience. To paraphrase what you said, get thee to a =
good show 
or study group as often as possible. 
PS: The same goes for the =
study of tosogu.
